Package gr.interamerican.bo2.arch.ext

This package contains interfaces extending the Bo2 stereotypes to the application layer.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Cache<C extends Comparable<? super C>> Cache caches the values of objects used often and changed rare.
Cached<M extends Cached.Metadata<?>,E extends TypedSelectable<C>,C extends Comparable<? super C>> Cached object.
Cached.Metadata<MC extends Comparable<? super MC>> Metadata about the type of an entry.
Codified<C extends Comparable<? super C>> An object that has a code for its identification.
Consumer<R> Consumes a resource.
Copier<T> Object copier interface.
CriteriaDependent<T> An object that depends from criteria.
CrudPerformer Performer of CRUD operation.
EnhancedCache<C extends Comparable<? super C>,R,L> EnhancedCache provides a cache and a Translator for this cache.
Injector<R> Injects a resource to its Consumer.
LoginOperation<A> Login operation.
OutputMedium An OutputMedium is a class that can present output to the user.
OwnedEntry<C extends Comparable<? super C>,R,L> An entry that knows its owner.
Selectable<C extends Comparable<? super C>> A codified object with a name can be selected by its code.
Session<A,L> Interface for the session of a user in an application.
SqlOwner Interface for types that encapsulate an sql statement in a property called sql.
SubTyped Something that belongs to a sub-type of a registered type.
Translatable<R,L> An object that can have translations in different languages.
TranslatableEntry<C extends Comparable<? super C>,R,L> Translatable typed selectable.
TranslatableEntryOwner<C extends Comparable<? super C>,R,L> Owner of a TranslatableEntry.
Translator<R,L> A translator can translate resource identifiers to their descriptions.
Typed Something that belongs to a registered type.
TypedSelectable<C extends Comparable<? super C>> Typed and Selectable.
User<A> Common interface for the user of an application.
 

Package gr.interamerican.bo2.arch.ext Description

This package contains interfaces extending the Bo2 stereotypes to the application layer.
